name: Overview
main:
On 2 April, the Ethiopian parliament elected Abiy Ahmed, head of the Oromo Peoples Democratic Organization (OPDO), to succeed Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn, who resigned on 15 February. Ahmed is Ethiopia's first prime minister from the Oromia region. The new government pursues a politic and economic reformist agenda.?

However, several internal conflicts and security issues have led to greater humanitarian needs across the country in 2018. Hostilities between Oromo and Somali groups over border demarcations and resources have led to significant casualties, deaths, and displacement. Fighting escalated in Jigjiga (eastern Somali region) at the beginning of August. Intercommunal violence has displaced people in the SNNP region (Gedeos) and Oromia region (Gujis) since April and in Benishangul-Gumuz and Oromia regions since September. There are 2.6 million IDPs in the country. ?

Consecutive below-average rainy seasons have caused severe drought across northern, eastern, and central Ethiopia.? However, the 2018 belg rainfall season (February-June) led to flooding along river basins in Oromia, Somali and SNNP regions, affecting people.?

Hosting over 900,000 refugees from neighbouring countries, including 420,000 from South Sudan, most of Ethiopia’s refugee camps have reached full capacity. Overcrowding, malnutrition, and critical shortfalls in humanitarian aid are of concern. Most refugees have been in protracted displacement, but remain in need of assistance.?

Following the Joint Declaration of Peace and Friendship signed by the Eritrean and Ethiopian governments, Zalambesa and Bure border crossing points were reopened on 11 September. Since the border has been opened, a new wave of refugees has been registered at the Endabaguna Reception Centre.  Main humanitarian needs are shelter and healthcare.?

INFORM measures Ethiopia's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster as high at 6.9/10. Lack of coping capacity is of particular concern at 7.7/10.?
latest_developments_past:
20/11: Ethnic conflict along the Oromia - Somali border forced 200,000 people to flee to camps in Somali region since July. Health needs are reported, which are heightened due to the measles outbreak. ?

20/11: Violence in late September in Benishangul-Gumuz Region aggravated already existing ethnic tensions resulting in approximately 200,000 new IDPs.?

19/11: 400 people fled ethnic clashes between Amhara and Tigray in Ethiopia to Sudan.?
